result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin A Brehm

Adjustment Number: 22A 434841,
Payable Number: 463748,
Receipt Number: 22R 008518F,
Amount: $20.00

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive unless properly licensed. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:41 PM Defendant Kevin A Brehm in court.  Attorney Christy M Hall in court for Kevin A Brehm.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense challenges probable cause as to injury and this case should be an OWI 1st offense.
BTC: Probable cause exists as to injury. 
State moves to have defense file a motion regarding her request.
BTC: Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
